categories.title: All Job Industries

guide.pageTitle: Complete Guide to Working in Europe
guide.pageDescription: Comprehensive information for Romanian workers seeking employment opportunities across European countries including Denmark, Germany, Netherlands, and France.
guide.noVisaDescription: Romanian citizens can work freely across EU countries without work permits or visas
guide.cprDescription: Each country has its own registration system - get your local identification number within days of arrival
guide.conditionsDescription: Competitive salaries, social benefits, and legal protections vary by country but are standardized across EU
guide.cprSectionDescription: Learn about different registration systems across European countries and how to complete them efficiently
guide.whatIsCprDescription: Denmark (CPR), Germany (Personal Number), Netherlands (BSN), France (NIR) - each country has unique identifiers for work, healthcare, and taxation.
guide.cprStructureDescription: Different formats across countries: Denmark (DDMMYY-XXXX), Germany (€11-15/hour), Netherlands (9 digits), France (15 digits with INSEE structure).
guide.cprStep1: Contact local municipality or OFII/immigration office within 3-5 days
guide.cprStep2: Present passport/ID, employment contract, and accommodation proof
guide.cprStep3: Complete registration forms in local language (assistance available)
guide.cprStep4: Receive identification number within 1-5 working days
guide.cprStep5: Use number for banking, healthcare, tax registration, and payroll
guide.languageDescription: Language proficiency requirements vary by country and job type
guide.physicalWorkDescription: Basic physical labor positions require minimal language skills across EU
guide.serviceWorkDescription: Basic communication skills in local language recommended
guide.specializedWorkDescription: Professional language fluency may be required for office and technical roles
guide.workingConditionsDescription: Understanding your rights and obligations as a worker in the EU

employeeRights.8: Trade union support and collective bargaining
employeeRights.9: Minimum 3 days notice period for termination
employeeRights.10: Right to complaint and fair dismissal procedures

legalObligations.1: Valid passport or EU ID card
legalObligations.4: Inform employer of any absences promptly
legalObligations.7: Pay your share of social security contributions

guide.consularDescription: Official assistance with legal documents, translation services, and emergency support
guide.employmentDescription: Expert guidance on European job markets, salary negotiations, and career development
